channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Nvidia is reportedly reshuffling its cloud efforts to better combat growing competition
item.description: Nvidia had reportedly scaled back its cloud businesses so as not to take on AWS, Azure and Google Cloud.

item.title: Safety Panel Calls Out NASA for Downplaying the Boeing Starliner Mess
item.description: The space agency failed to declare the spacecraft's thruster glitch as a mishap, creating confusion and uncertainty.

item.title: US insurance giant Aflac says hackers stole personal and health data of 22.6 million
item.description: Aflac, one of the largest insurance companies in the U.S., confirmed hackers stole reams of personal data, including Social Security numbers, identity documents, and health information.

item.title: L’excellent Samsung Galaxy A56 accompagné de son éclatante dalle Amoled perd 42 % de son prix
item.description: Le Samsung A56 est un super smartphone de milieu de gamme, notamment grâce à une superbe dalle Amoled. Chez Amazon, il tombe à 289 euros et s'approche des téléphones les plus abordables du marché.

item.title: Forfaits Sosh : ce qu’il faut savoir sur les offres internet et mobiles de l’opérateur low-cost d’Orange
item.description: Sosh est la filiale low-cost d'Orange, elle permet de profiter du réseau de l'opérateur historique à un prix plus accessible et sans engagement. Cette année, Sosh a considérablement modernisé son offre avec notamment l'arrivée d'une box Wi-Fi 7 à bas coût comme ce que fait B&YOU, mais le reste est-il à la hauteur ?

item.title: Droit d’auteur : une nouvelle plainte vise six géants de l’IA aux États-Unis
item.description: Des auteurs ont décidé, outre Atlantique, de porter plainte contre les principales sociétés de l'IA. Comme dans d'autres procédures, les écrivains accusent les géants du secteur d'avoir utilisé des bibliothèques illicites, dans lesquelles se trouvent leurs oeuvres, pour entraîner leurs systèmes. Ce sans autorisation et en violation de leur droit d'auteur, selon ces derniers....

item.title: Les astronomes stupéfaits : la tempête géante de Jupiter oscille comme un bol de gélatine
item.description: La Grande tache rouge de Jupiter est observée par les astronomes depuis au moins 150 ans. Ils ont récemment découvert un comportement tout à fait inattendu grâce au télescope spatial Hubble.

item.title: ‘Anaconda’ Slithers on That Line of So Bad, It’s Good
item.description: Jack Black, Paul Rudd, Steve Zahn, and Thandiwe Newton star in the meta comedy remake, out Christmas Day.

item.title: This founder just landed funding for a second go at the same problem: affordable custom home design
item.description: Drafted is now nearly five months old, and it's everything Atmos wasn't.

item.title: Here are the best live service games to spend the Holiday season in, from Fortnite’s cozy Winterfest to the snow-covered hills of Arc Raiders
item.description: It's time to settle into the various Holiday events currently running in live service games. Here's my picks for the 6 best that are worth your time over Christmas.

item.title: Prime members can claim loads of free games in latest Amazon giveaway including one of the best PC strategy games ever
item.description: Amazon Prime members shouldn't miss the current deluge of free games available with Luna.

item.title: Voici le meilleur smartphone de l’année – Frandroid Awards 2025
item.description: Parmi les modèles testés par Frandroid, le Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra se distingue en recevant le prix du meilleur smartphone de 2025 lors des Frandroid Awards avec Delos. Voici pourquoi.

item.title: Marissa Mayer’s new startup Dazzle raises $8M led by Forerunner’s Kirsten Green
item.description: Mayer launched Dazzle after shuttering her photo and contact management startup Sunshine.

item.title: Cyberattaque La Poste : des hackers prorusses revendiquent la paralysie des services
item.description: Alors que les services en ligne de La Poste reviennent péniblement à la normale ce mardi, une piste se dessine sur l'identité des assaillants. Le groupe de cybercriminels prorusses « NoName057(16) » a revendiqué l'attaque sur les réseaux sociaux. Une information à prendre avec précaution, qui n'a pas été confirmée par l'entreprise publique.

item.title: Trump’s War on Offshore Wind Is a Gut Punch to the AI Boom
item.description: U.S. electricity consumption is growing for the first time in a decade l due to AI, so why are we stunting renewable energy development?

item.title: Xbox cloud gaming comes to newer Amazon Fire TV models
item.description: Xbox has brought cloud gaming gaming to some Amazon Fire TV models. These include the Fire TV 4-Series and the Fire TV Omni QLED Series. This lets people play Xbox games directly on the television, without needing a bulky console or even something like a Fire TV stick. Gamers do need a couple of things. First and foremost, this service requires a subscription to Game Pass. Plans start at $10 a month and shoot all the way up to $30 per month. They'll also need a compatible wireless controller, though most Bluetooth-enabled gamepads should work. Amazon The feature works for every game on the Ga...

item.title: Une « grosse claque » : le patron européen du design Stellantis nous explique comment l’IA leur permet de gagner du temps et de l’argent
item.description: Après une brève excursion chez Renault, Gilles Vidal revient chez Stellantis pour chapeauter le design des marques européennes du groupe. Nous l'avons rencontré pour discuter du futur du design automobile à l'ère de la voiture électrique, de l'intelligence artificielle et des innombrables marques chinoises.

item.title: FCC bans new foreign-made drones over national security concerns
item.description: The FCC cited upcoming major events, including the 2026 World Cup, as reasons to address potential drone threats. The Federal Communications Commission on Monday said it would ban new foreign-made drones, a move that will keep new Chinese-made drones such as those from DJI and Autel out of the U.S. market.

item.title: DOJ appears to bungle Epstein Files redactions
item.description: The Justice Department has blamed its delayed release of some so-called Epstein files on needing more time to redact sensitive information, like details identifying the victims of convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. But at least some of the redactions so far released appear to mistakenly disclose information meant to be obscured from the public. A […]...

item.title: Au Brésil aussi, Apple va devoir ouvrir l’App Store à la concurrence
item.description: Sous la pression des régulateurs, Apple consent à une nouvelle entaille dans l’armure de l’App Store. Au Brésil, le groupe s’est engagé à ouvrir son écosystème à des paiements et boutiques alternatives, mettant fin à une enquête antitrust — sans renoncer pour autant à ses commissions, ni à sa stratégie d’ouverture au compte-gouttes.

item.title: The Boox Note Air 5C Makes Me More Excited for the Next Generation of Color E-Notetakers
item.description: Yes, the Boox Note Air 5C is less expensive than a Kindle Scribe Colorsoft. It's still not cheap by any standard.

item.title: Watch lists are broken. Federation could fix them.
item.description: This is Lowpass by Janko Roettgers, a newsletter on the ever-evolving intersection of tech and entertainment, syndicated just for The Verge subscribers once a week. Lowpass is taking a winter break and will be back on January 8, 2026. All I want for Christmas is to find that darn movie I've been meaning to watch. […]

item.title: La « refonte » 3G de Free tourne au cauchemar pour certains smartphones
item.description: Votre téléphone affiche "4G", vos données fonctionnent, mais vos appels coupent ou n'aboutissent jamais ? Ne cherchez pas, ce n'est pas une panne temporaire. C'est structurel. Free est en train de transformer son réseau, et si votre smartphone n'est pas prêt, vous risquez bien plus qu'une conversation manquée.

item.title: New York’s landmark AI safety bill was defanged — and universities were part of the push against it
item.description: A group of tech companies and academic institutions spent tens of thousands of dollars in the past month - likely between $17,000 and $25,000 - on an ad campaign against New York's landmark AI safety bill, which may have reached more than two million people, according to Meta's Ad Library. The landmark bill is called […]

item.title: Dyson Spot+Scrub Ai robot vacuum first impressions: an impressive featureset but a disappointing app
item.description: All I want for Christmas is a Dyson robovac redemption – can the Spot+Scrub Ai deliver it?

item.title: New York Times reporter files lawsuit against AI companies
item.description: Investigative reporter John Carreyrou of the New York Times filed a lawsuit against xAI, Anthropic, Google, OpenAI, Meta and Perplexity on Monday for allegedly training their AI models on copyrighted books without permission. Carreyrou is perhaps best known for exposing the Theranos fraudulent blood test scandal. According to Reuters, the lawsuit was filed alongside five other writers who all claim big tech companies have been violating their intellectual property rights in the name of building large language models. This comes after a banner year for IP lawsuits against AI companies brought b...

item.title: Nissan says Red Hat breach affected thousands of customers
item.description: The September 2025 breach at Red Hat also exposed Nissan customer files -affecting around 21,000 people.

item.title: Dozens of Flock AI camera feeds were just out there
item.description: The livestreams connected to more than 60 of Flock's AI-powered surveillance cameras were left available to view on the web, allowing someone to see live feeds of each location without needing a username or password, according to findings from tech YouTuber Benn Jordan and 404 Media. Flock is a technology company that works with thousands […]

item.title: ‘It’s good to have limitations’: Clair Obscur: Expedition 33's creative director says Sandfall Interactive's next game won’t on a bigger scale despite huge success
item.description: Sandfall Interactive's CEO and creative director, Guillaume Broche, has said the studio won't be expanding the scale of its next game, despite Clair Obscur: Expedition 33's success, because it loves "making games more than we love managing."

item.title: Des Galaxy S Ultra et Z Fold à 400 euros : la police démantèle une fabrique de faux Samsung
item.description: Une vaste opération de contrefaçon de smartphones Samsung a été démantelée à New Delhi. Quatre individus assemblaient des modèles Galaxy S Ultra, Z Fold et Z Flip à partir de composants importés de Chine pour les revendre.

item.title: Fuel their curiosity for less — save $28 on the Amazon Echo Dot Kids smart speaker
item.description: With parental controls, an extended warranty, and a one-year subscription to Amazon Kids+, this is a deal worth taking.

item.title: Les plaques d’immatriculation roses débarquent en France le 1er janvier 2026, voici pourquoi
item.description: Aujourd'hui, une plaque provisoire WW ressemble exactement à une plaque normale. Même format blanc, même typo. Demain, elles seront roses.

item.title: 9 of the best gift cards available in the UK with immediate delivery — Amazon, PlayStation, Ikea, John Lewis, and more
item.description: Missed the final shipping days, but still need a last-minute gift? No problem - here are some of the best gift cards available this Christmas with immediate digital delivery.

item.title: Amazon’s AI assistant Alexa+ now works with Angi, Expedia, Square, and Yelp
item.description: The new integrations join other services like Yelp, Uber, OpenTable and others.

item.title: J’adore la tech, mais je ne suis pas sûr de vouloir de Google Gemini dans mon frigo Samsung
item.description: On connaissait les frigos connectés. Samsung a du nouveau pour le CES 2026 avec une approche radicale : utiliser la vision par ordinateur de Google Gemini pour scanner l'intérieur de vos boîtes de conservation. L'idée ? Vous dire quoi cuisiner avec vos restes. Le prix à payer ? Google s'invite (encore plus) dans votre intimité.

item.title: Tesla ferait rouler un nombre ridicule de robotaxis à Austin
item.description: Le service de robotaxis Tesla lancé cet été à Austin serait un miroir aux alouettes. Les données collectées par un étudiant ingénieur montre que le constructeur ferait circuler moins d'une dizaine de véhicules autonomes (chacun avec un superviseur humain au volant) dans la ville texane. Un volume ridicule, mais qui n'empêche pas Elon Musk d'annoncer monts et merveilles....

item.title: Japan will restart the world’s largest nuclear plant after clearing this last major hurdle
item.description: The Kashiwazaki-Kariwa plant, which has been offline since 2012, is made up of seven reactors. The governor of Niigata on Tuesday formally gave local consent to put two reactors at the Kashiwazaki-Kariwa nuclear power plant in the north-central prefecture back online, clearing a last hurdle toward restarting the plant idled for more than a decade following the 2011 meltdowns at another plant managed by the same utility....

item.title: Is Doctor Doom going after all the super babies in Avengers: Doomsday?
item.description: Between "Fantastic Four: First Steps" end-credits scene and the "Avengers: Doomsday" trailer, it seems like Doctor Doom is going after kids.

item.title: Watch ILM Recreate the Death Star Trench Run Out of Virtual Gingerbread
item.description: The festive short kicks off a new 'Star Wars Minis' series that recreates classic moments from film and TV in new materials and styles.

item.title: Belkin’s camera grip power bank is a few upgrades away from being a must-have
item.description: Belkin's Stage PowerGrip has shown me that I should be asking more from a wireless magnetic power bank than just boosting battery life while it hangs off the back of my phone. Its clever design adds layers of extra functionality, and the inclusion of a retractable two-way charging cable expands the number of devices you […]

item.title: Lemon Slice nabs $10.5M from YC and Matrix to build out its digital avatar tech
item.description: Digital avatar generation company Lemon Slice is working to add a video layer to AI chatbots with a new diffusion model that can create digital avatars from a single image.

item.title: How to watch Arsenal vs Crystal Palace for *FREE* — Stream Carabao Cup Quarter-Final 25/26
item.description: All the ways to watch Arsenal vs Crystal Palace live streams, with Ebere Eze and Eddie Nketiah set to face their old sides in the Carabao Cup quarter-finals.

item.title: Ce chargeur ultra-rapide Realme (120 W) coûte moins de 20 €, mais ça ne va pas durer
item.description: Compact et puissant, le chargeur Realme SuperVOOC de 120 W permet aux appareils compatibles d'atteindre les 100 % en un rien de temps. Actuellement, Amazon le propose à 19,99 euros au lieu de 29,99 euros, aujourd'hui uniquement.

item.title: One last holiday hurrah for the $50 off deal on the Switch 2
item.description: In case you’ve waited until the very last minute to buy Christmas gifts, and there’s a Switch 2 on your shopping list, you’ve really lucked out here. Not only is Nintendo’s powerful handheld readily available online and in stores, it’s still $50 off for the best console bundle you can buy. The set that includes […]

item.title: The Wegovy Weight-Loss Pill Is Officially Here
item.description: It's the first GLP-1 pill approved for treating obesity.

item.title: Top DOJ Official Shut Down Enforcement Against Crypto Companies While Holding More Than $150,000 in Crypto Investments
item.description: The second-highest official at the DOJ, Todd Blanche rose to prominence as Trump’s personal defense attorney. His actions violated the federal conflicts of interest law and his ethics agreement, experts say.

item.title: France’s postal and banking services disrupted by suspected DDoS attack
item.description: France's postal service, La Poste, said it was hit by a disruptive cyberattack that knocked its services offline.

item.title: Surfshark expands dedicated IP to Linux in its latest desktop update
item.description: Surfshark has added dedicated IP support to its Linux GUI app, extending a feature it’s been focusing on since 2023.

item.title: The Samsung Galaxy Tab A9 Plus is back to its super-cheap Black Friday price
item.description: The Samsung Galaxy Tab A9 Plus is a basic entry-level tablet, and it's now back down to its super-low Black Friday price on Amazon.

item.title: Quel est le meilleur des iPhone : la sélection des modèles à acheter (et ceux à éviter)
item.description: Faut-il acheter le dernier iPhone ou bien opter pour un autre smartphone de chez Apple ? C'est à cette question que nous allons tenter de répondre dans ce guide d'achat. Quel iPhone choisir ? Voici les conseils et recommandations de la rédaction de Frandroid.

item.title: This Modern ‘Game Boy’ Can Play Dreamcast, GameCube, and PS2 Games
item.description: It looks pretty solid!

item.title: YggTorrent au bord de l’implosion : la guerre est déclarée entre le site pirate et sa communauté
item.description: C'est une fronde inédite qui secoue le géant du téléchargement illégal français. Depuis ce début de semaine, YggTorrent est le théâtre d'un conflit ouvert entre ses administrateurs et ses utilisateurs les plus actifs. En cause : un durcissement commercial jugé inacceptable, qui a entraîné le bannissement d'une des équipes de pirates les plus populaires du réseau....

item.title: Find all your lost items in seconds with $10 off the Tile Slim
item.description: As of Dec. 23, get the Tile Slim Bluetooth tracker for $10 off its normal price at Amazon.

item.title: OpenAI’s Outlook on AI Browser Security Is Bleak, but Maybe a Little More AI Can Fix It
item.description: The company behind ChatGPT says prompt injection vulnerabilities will likely never be fully ‘solved.’

item.title: University of Phoenix data breach may have hit over 3.5 million victims - here's what we know
item.description: Cl0p claims another victim as University of Phoenix confirms losing data of around 3.5 million people.
